initial_story:
You are certainly no friend of mine. You have accused me of lying about what you had said, and run away when I proved by actual quotation that the accusation was false. We both know that, even though you praise humility, you are not humble enough to apologize.

 You sneered at my combat experience, saying "A lot of so called "combat veterans" of Vietnam smelled more perfume from call girls than they smelled cordite" and "So when you were an Army officer in Vietnam (even though you spent your time inside of Danang airbase, with at least two battalions of infantry marines on the wire ) what was the combat load for M-16 ammo per soldier on a daily patrol?" An actual friend would not have written such things.

No, you are no friend of mine, you ignorant, arrogant, hypocritical blow-hard. You should be able to guess that I do not feel friendly towards you
stories: After making such disparaging remarks about my military service and questioning my integrity, it's clear that you have no intention of mending our friendship. Your words have only served to deepen the divide between us. I have no desire to continue this hostile exchange. I wish you the best in your future endeavors, even if that means parting ways as acquaintances rather than friends.

I understand your position and I apologize if my words came across as disrespectful towards your military service or your integrity. It was never my intention to cause you harm or to deepen the divide between us. I value the friendship we once had and I am open to finding a way to move past this misunderstanding. If you are willing to give our friendship another chance, I would be happy to work towards rebuilding the trust and understanding that was once there. If not, I will respect your decision and wish you the best in all your future endeavors.

I appreciate your apology and your willingness to make things right between us. I also value the friendship we once shared and I am open to giving it another chance. Let's find a time to talk in person or over the phone to discuss how we can move past this misunderstanding and rebuild the trust that was lost. I believe that with open communication and mutual respect, we can overcome any obstacle and strengthen our friendship once again.

I completely agree with you. I'm glad we can both come to this understanding. Let me suggest some possible dates and times for us to meet and discuss this further. I'm open to whatever works best for you, and I'm committed to approaching our conversation with an open mind and a sincere desire to resolve any issues between us. I believe that through open and honest communication, we can rebuild the trust and strengthen our friendship once again. Let me know what you think.
